result.execSummary:
The defendant Wallace O. Yarbrough was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Full Huber, Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by September 28 2022  for report date within 60 days or no later than November 22 2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 9:03 AM Defendant Wallace O. Yarbrough in court.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly in court for Wallace O. Yarbrough.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds the defendant  guilty. Court orders 60 days Jail with Full Huber and Diversion. Defendant to contact diversion by September 28, 2022 and report no later than November 22 2022. Court costs due December 2 2022. 3 days credit.
